image.altText: Jacinta Allan looks serious at an outdoor press conference.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government is promising tougher bail accountability for young people accused of serious crimes but is backing out of a pledge to raise the age of criminal responsibility to 14.

title.children: Victorian Aboriginal communities accuse government of 'weak leadership' over abandoned promise on criminal age

image.altText: Jacinta Allan appears thoughtful, standing at a formal government press conference.

props.synopsis: Victoria's upper house will this week debate a government bill raising the age of criminal responsibility from 10 to 12, but it comes just as community concerns about youth crime are peaking.

title.children: Raising the criminal age to 14 was a signature Daniel Andrews move — why has his successor dumped it?

image.altText: Teenage students solve maths problems in workbooks.

props.synopsis: One in three Australian school students are still not meeting literacy and numeracy benchmarks, and more than one in ten are so far behind they need additional support, the 2024 NAPLAN results show.

title.children: One in three students failing to meet English and maths standards, NAPLAN data shows

image.altText: Nicola Gobbo, known as Lawyer X, wearing a leopard print top stares out a window

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has revealed it plans to introduce laws preventing anyone seeking to sue Victoria Police in relation to the disastrous Lawyer X affair — in which Ms Gobbo provided information to police about her gangland clients.

title.children: Nicola Gobbo in 'very poor health' as Victorian government moves to block her lawsuit against police

image.altText: A man scans a QR code with his phone. Behind him, there is a cafe worker at a counter.

props.synopsis: Providing proof of age at the pub, details for checking in at a hotel, and qualifications when applying for a job, the government's proposed "Trust Exchange" system would allow Australians to do it all in a single tap with their phone.

title.children: A new digital ID is hoped to take the hassle out of renting, banking and visiting the pub

image.altText: charred helicopter wreckage lifted from hotel roof

props.synopsis: Nautilus Aviation said the employee held a New Zealand pilot's licence but had never flown in Australia

title.children: Ground crew member killed in Cairns helicopter crash was celebrating promotion night before

image.altText: Linda Reynolds speaks at a doorstop as the PM Scott Morrison stands behind her grinning

props.synopsis: The defamation trial between WA senator Linda Reynolds and her ex-staffer Brittany Higgins hears from former Prime Minister Scott Morrison.

title.children: Scott Morrison says Linda Reynolds's 'lying cow' comment was 'out of character'

image.altText: clare o'neil qt

props.synopsis: After mopping up a blunder on housing data, Clare O'Neil was targeted once again in question time over a remark she made about the CFMEU and house prices.

title.children: Housing minister targeted over CFMEU house price claim

image.altText: A person walks down a new suburban street as the sun sets.

props.synopsis: Melbourne's population continues to grow, but there are growing calls for services such as public transport to be expanded to match the boom.

title.children: Melbourne is growing fast, but on the fringes, public transport isn't

image.altText: A business executive in a suit speaking behind a podium at a mining forum.

props.synopsis: Evolution Mining has confirmed to authorities and the Australian Stock Exchange that it has been targeted in a ransomware attack.

title.children: Major gold miner targeted in cyber attack

image.altText: A pair of gloved hands clasp the hands of a child, which are covered in a rash.

props.synopsis: Jean Kaseya, head of the Africa Centres for Disease Control, said the declaration marked a "clarion call to action" for more proactive efforts against the disease.

title.children: Mpox declared public health emergency in Africa by top health body

image.altText: A man with short light brown hair in a navy suit looks offended as he reaches for a car door handle while standing in a carpark.

props.synopsis: A Canberra gambler hoping for "a big win" is convicted of fraud after stealing more than $70,000 from the Master Builders Association while working as an event organiser for the association.

title.children: Canberra gambler avoids jail for stealing over $70,000 from Master Builders Association

image.altText: twitter pic reuters

props.synopsis: A network of 5,000 accounts apparently being operated using AI has been exposed on X, formerly Twitter, with concerns the Beijing-based operation could be designed to disrupt the coming US election.

title.children: Beijing-based AI network 'Green Cicada' exposed on X, with fears of plan to disrupt US election

image.altText: Two men hold a firehose in front of a fire on shrubland.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Greek firefighters are battling a wildfire that has now entered Athens and killed at least one person.

title.children: Europe's firefighters called to help battle Greek blaze as one person reported dead

image.altText: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi points at a reporter

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Paul Keating's comments on Taiwan draw international attention as former US speaker of the house Nancy Pelosi goes on the attack over his "Chinese real estate" remark.

title.children: As Pelosi attacks Keating's Taiwan comments, she says she would have hit Trump at US Capitol on January 6

image.altText: Ukrainian servicemen sit on tops of a military vehicle, realxing with one eating a packet of chips.

props.synopsis: Since launching a surprise attack last week, Moscow has been unable to push Ukrainian troops back after they advanced up to 30km into Russian territory and are now in control of about 28 settlements.

title.children: 'Embarrassing for Putin': Russian territory is under occupation for the first time since WWII

image.altText: A middle-aged African man wearing a white-grey polo shirt stands behind a bench in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Paul Mackenzie is alleged to have incited his followers to starve to death in order to "meet Jesus" in a case that has provoked horror in Kenya and across the world.

title.children: Kenyan cult leader on trial for manslaughter over hundreds of deaths

image.altText: Peta Murphy sits in a committee room inside Parliament House

props.synopsis: Peta Murphy's final political act was convincing those who sat opposite her in parliament of the need to tackle online gambling. But it's a message that looks to have fallen short with those who sat much closer on the government's frontbench.

title.children: It had rare bipartisan support thanks to a brave MP, but now Labor has put gambling reform on hold

image.altText: Generic picture of Australian bank notes

props.synopsis: The annual pace of wage growth has remained steady in the June quarter, at 4.1 per cent, with an increase in public sector wage growth offsetting a decline in private sector wages.

title.children: 'A little too strong for inflation': What recent wage price data tells us about future interest rate decisions

image.altText: Christian Petracca of the Melbourne Demons running with the AFL ball, looking over his right shoulder for a teammate

props.synopsis: Melbourne has moved quickly to quieten media speculation suggesting its injured star Christian Petracca was seeking an exit from the club this summer.

title.children: Demons CEO issues letter to members in wake of Christian Petracca trade rumours

image.altText: Mitchell Butel, a 54-year-old man, wearing a bright, multicoloured jumper, smiles as he leans forward in a chair, hands clasped.

props.synopsis: Award-winning actor, writer and director Mitchell Butel will leave State Theatre Company South Australia to join Sydney Theatre Company at the end of the year.

title.children: Theatre is 'fun, sexy and cool': The new artistic director of STC has a plan to challenge Netflix

image.altText: A flag that says CFMEU flying at a construction site.

props.synopsis: A construction industry insider who alleges he was physically struck by a CFMEU member has accused union officials of acting like "the meanest bully you've ever come across."

title.children: 'Enough is enough': Construction insider relates CFMEU 'bully' tactics

image.altText: A mural of a Bangladeshi woman with her head partially covered

props.synopsis: Hindus and Muslims came together in Bangladesh in nationwide protests for political reform. Now, old fissures are being reopened.

title.children: 'This country is not for us': Bangladesh's Hindus in fear as attacks and misinformation inflame tensions

image.altText: Elon Musk

props.synopsis: The site showed that the page was "not available" shortly after the scheduled start for some users.

title.children: Elon Musk claims 'massive DDOS attack' on X during Donald Trump interview

image.altText: Nathaniel, Gareth and Stacey Train graphic black and white with aerial view of their property behind

props.synopsis: Three "radicalised" conspiracy theorists who gunned down two police officers and their neighbour believed they were in a "final battle" as "the end" arrived, a Queensland court has heard.

title.children: Extremism expert tells Wieambilla inquest the 'battle arrived' the moment the officers crossed 'the Rubicon'

image.altText: Jordan Chiles posing with a gold and bronze Olympic medal from the Paris Games

props.synopsis: USA Gymnastics officials have said an arbitration panel will not reconsider a decision asking gymnast Jordan Chiles to return the bronze medal she was awarded in the floor exercise at the Paris Olympics.

title.children: CAS reportedly will not consider allowing US gymnast to keep bronze medal won by Romanian

image.altText: Beau Lamarre in a police uniform

props.synopsis: It was the first time Beau Lamarre-Condon's case has been in court since police last month laid two fresh charges which now allege the murders were domestic violence-related.

title.children: Former police officer accused of murdering Sydney couple has charges replaced

image.altText: A woman, holds her mouth open, and shows off her teeth after dental work.

props.synopsis: An Indian dental clinic which markets cut-price services to Australians has been accused of using fake online reviews and price gouging — leaving one woman in pain after she travelled to the subcontinent for care.

title.children: The Australian woman in 'constant pain' after travelling to India for cheaper dental work

image.altText: A photo of a man in a lab.

props.synopsis: More than two dozen lab tests have been unable to diagnose long COVID, according to new research which suggests there may be no reliable way to diagnose the condition.

title.children: There is no single test to diagnose long COVID patients, international researchers say

image.altText: Ellie Carpenter, Katrina Gorry and Mackenzie Arnold all looking confused on the football pitch, questioning a ref decision

props.synopsis: Matildas players, including injured captain Sam Kerr, will be consulted by Football Australia in the crucial search for the team's next coach.

title.children: Matildas players to be consulted over new head coach

image.altText: A man and woman stand on a stage

props.synopsis: Once a Democratic stronghold, Wisconsin flipped for Trump in 2016. Now, both Republicans and Democrats are scrambling for votes in America's "dairyland".

title.children: To beat Trump, Harris will likely need this small state. Here's how she and Walz are faring in Wisconsin

image.altText: Outside of building.

props.synopsis: The company that operates a northern Gold Coast childcare centre has faced court after two young children walked out a gate and along a busy road in 2022.

title.children: Childcare centre fined after two young toddlers escaped through open gate

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab and long dress stands next to a window in a corridor with her hand on the window sill

props.synopsis: People from southern Lebanon have had to flee the daily air strikes on their villages, and for months have stayed in derelict hotels-turned-shelters.

title.children: Displaced Lebanese beg to go home as country braces for worse fighting

image.altText: Albanese walks and looks serious on the lower house floor.

props.synopsis: Laws to restrict gambling advertising are being bargained over inside Labor's caucus, as the prime minister warns a misstep could have "unintended consequences" for Australia.

title.children: Government bargains to win over Labor MPs on laws to ban gambling ads around children's programs and live sport

image.altText: A marle statue of three headless female figures, standing nude, side by side, with arms on one another.

props.synopsis: From the influence of the devil to overzealous restorers, there are numerous strange reasons and theories behind the conspicuous lack of pubic hair on women depicted in Western art.

title.children: The nude female body has been depicted in art countless times. But where is all the pubic hair?
